Author: bpkdasbaum#4592
Content: The problem is usually the word "why". This is a word that attacks the being of a person, it triggers emotional responses from the  limbic parts of the brain, questions your core. If you don't know your communication partner well it's better to stay way from these types of questions and stay neutral. So what/when/who questions. This already set him up in a defensive position.

Author: bpkdasbaum#4592
Content: Yeah, don't think it was your intention. Why questions are tricky in this regard in general. The moment you ask them, they start to question the very core of your being. Why did you do X, our brain autoamtically start going crazy on those thoughts without us realizing and triggers a fight or flight reflex in the limbic brain, worst case scenario one snaps back
